title: Please could you let me know what the form 870-IS, Waiver of Collection Restriction in Innocent Spouse Cases means?
question: I'm the first generation in USA and most of the IRS I don't understand. Applied for Innocence Spouse Relief and got the letter which I don't completely understand. Not employed now, and with no income I couldn't pay tax attn.
answers: You do not want to sign that form without getting advice from a competent tax lawyer or, at a minimum, a competent CPA, of which there are many in your area. The IRS will begin collection activity almost as soon as you sign.

They are offering to relieve you of part of the obligation to pay the understated taxes, but not all of it. The 870-IS simply allows them to begin collection without having to wait 90 days from the date of your final determination letter, assuming you do not file a petition in tax court. That's about all I can tell you without more information.
You have not provided enough information to answer this Q. In general, this a consent form that allows the IRS to collect over-assessed debts. See a tax lawyer in your area.
